leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 计算科学方法论与数值计算生态
leaf_cluster.typical_objects: 稀疏矩阵/算子, 网格与离散系统, PDE/ODE, 误差/收敛数据
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 离散化→求解→误差/稳定性→加速→验证→可复现
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 数值库/求解器框架 + 自动微分/可微分计算 + HPC

unit.unit_name: 可微分科学计算与自动微分（diff. programming）
unit.coverage_tools: AD 框架、可微分求解器、可微分 PDE/ODE、梯度验证

tools.name: ClimODE
tools.one_line_profile: Climate and weather forecasting model using physics-informed Neural ODEs
tools.detailed_description: ClimODE is a framework that combines physics-informed neural ordinary differential equations with climate modeling to provide accurate global weather forecasting. It integrates physical laws into the deep learning training process to improve generalization and physical consistency.

tools.name: jaxkineticmodel
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable systems biology modeling using JAX and Diffrax
tools.detailed_description: A library for building, simulating, and training kinetic models in systems biology. It leverages JAX for automatic differentiation and Diffrax for solving differential equations, enabling efficient parameter estimation and model analysis.

tools.name: AgentTorch
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable agent-based modeling framework
tools.detailed_description: AgentTorch is a framework for building large-scale, differentiable agent-based models (ABMs) using PyTorch. It allows for gradient-based calibration and optimization of agent-based simulations, suitable for epidemiology, economics, and other complex systems.

tools.name: XPINNs
tools.one_line_profile: Extended Physics-Informed Neural Networks for domain decomposition
tools.detailed_description: A generalized space-time domain decomposition-based deep learning framework (XPINNs) for solving nonlinear partial differential equations. It extends standard PINNs to handle complex geometries and large-scale problems via domain decomposition.

tools.name: Diffusion-based-Fluid-Super-resolution
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-informed diffusion model for CFD super-resolution
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of a physics-informed diffusion model designed for high-fidelity flow field reconstruction and super-resolution of Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) data.

tools.name: BattMo.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable battery simulation framework in Julia
tools.detailed_description: BattMo.jl is a tool for differentiable simulation of electrochemical devices, specifically batteries. Built on Jutul.jl, it enables sensitivity analysis and optimization of battery designs and operation protocols.

tools.name: exponax
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient differentiable PDE solvers in JAX
tools.detailed_description: Exponax provides efficient, differentiable solvers for n-dimensional Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) using JAX. It focuses on spectral methods and is designed for high-performance scientific computing tasks requiring gradient computation.

tools.name: Teg
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable programming language with integration primitives
tools.detailed_description: Teg is a differentiable programming language designed to handle derivatives of integrals, including those with discontinuous integrands. It is particularly useful for problems in physics simulation and graphics where such integrals are common.

tools.name: OceanParameterizations.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning for ocean model parameterizations
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for learning and validating parameterizations for ocean models using differentiable programming and machine learning techniques. It aims to improve the accuracy of climate models by better representing subgrid-scale ocean processes.

tools.name: DiffSMat
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable scattering matrix computation for photonics
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for differentiable scattering matrix (S-matrix) computation, enabling gradient-based design and optimization of photonic devices and layered structures.

tools.name: StiffNeuralODE
tools.one_line_profile: Solvers for Stiff Neural Ordinary Differential Equations
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing specialized solvers and methodologies for training Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (Neural ODEs) that exhibit stiffness, improving stability and performance in such regimes.

tools.name: reactorch
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable reacting flow simulation in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: Reactorch is a differentiable computational framework implemented in PyTorch for simulating reacting flows. It enables the integration of deep learning with chemical kinetics and fluid dynamics simulations for optimization and modeling.

tools.name: neural-odes-segmentation
tools.one_line_profile: Neural ODEs for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: An implementation applying Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (Neural ODEs) to the task of semantic segmentation in medical imaging, specifically for colon glands. It serves as a tool for exploring continuous-depth models in medical image analysis.

tools.name: DiffSharp
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable functional programming library for F#
tools.detailed_description: DiffSharp is a tensor library with support for automatic differentiation, implemented in F#. It enables differentiable functional programming and is designed for machine learning and scientific computing applications.

tools.name: DiscoGrad
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation across conditional branches in C++
tools.detailed_description: DiscoGrad is a C++ library that enables automatic differentiation through programs with discrete control flow and conditional branches, facilitating gradient-based optimization of algorithms that were previously non-differentiable.

tools.name: evox
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed GPU-accelerated evolutionary computation framework
tools.detailed_description: EvoX is a scalable and distributed framework for evolutionary computation, accelerated by GPUs using JAX. It provides a comprehensive library of evolutionary algorithms and benchmark problems for optimization tasks.

tools.name: scientific-paper-summarisation
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning models for summarizing scientific papers
tools.detailed_description: A tool utilizing machine learning models to automatically generate summaries for scientific papers, aiding researchers in literature review and information extraction.

tools.name: augmented-neural-odes
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of Augmented Neural ODEs
tools.detailed_description: A reference implementation of Augmented Neural ODEs in PyTorch. This library addresses the limitations of standard Neural ODEs in representing certain functions by augmenting the state space, serving as a building block for continuous-depth deep learning models.

tools.name: Enzyme
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance automatic differentiation for LLVM and MLIR
tools.detailed_description: Enzyme is a compiler plugin that performs automatic differentiation (AD) on LLVM intermediate representation (IR). It allows for high-performance, cross-language AD by operating at the compiler level, supporting languages like C, C++, Rust, and Julia.

tools.name: Enzyme.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia bindings for Enzyme automatic differentiation
tools.detailed_description: The Julia interface for the Enzyme automatic differentiator. It enables high-performance gradient computation for Julia code by leveraging the Enzyme LLVM plugin.

tools.name: Tensors.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient tensor computations with AD support in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for efficient operations on symmetric and non-symmetric tensors, specifically designed for finite element methods (FEM) and material modeling, with built-in support for automatic differentiation.

tools.name: YaoFlux.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable quantum circuit programming with Flux
tools.detailed_description: A library bridging Yao.jl (quantum computing simulation) and Flux.jl (machine learning), enabling differentiable programming and variational quantum algorithms on quantum circuits within the Julia ecosystem.

tools.name: Zygote.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Source-to-source automatic differentiation for Julia
tools.detailed_description: Zygote is a next-generation automatic differentiation (AD) system for the Julia language. It uses source-to-source transformation to generate efficient derivative code, powering the Flux machine learning library and the broader SciML ecosystem.

tools.name: JAX-GalSim
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable galaxy image simulation using JAX
tools.detailed_description: A JAX-based port of the GalSim library, enabling GPU-accelerated and differentiable simulations of galaxy images. This tool is essential for tasks in cosmology and astronomy requiring gradient-based optimization or inference.

tools.name: JaxSSO
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable FEA solver for structural optimization
tools.detailed_description: JaxSSO is a differentiable Finite Element Analysis (FEA) solver built on JAX, specifically designed for structural optimization tasks. It allows for efficient gradient computation in structural design problems.

tools.name: DiffTactile
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-based differentiable tactile simulator
tools.detailed_description: DiffTactile is a differentiable physics simulator focused on tactile sensing for robotic manipulation. It enables the simulation of contact-rich interactions and the learning of manipulation policies using gradient-based methods.

tools.name: Genesis
tools.one_line_profile: Generative world platform for embodied AI and robotics
tools.detailed_description: Genesis is a comprehensive simulation platform for general-purpose robotics and embodied AI. It supports physics-based simulation and generative world creation to facilitate the training and testing of embodied AI agents.

tools.name: ThinShellLab
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics simulation for thin-shell object manipulation
tools.detailed_description: ThinShellLab is a simulation environment for manipulating thin-shell objects (like cloth or paper) using differentiable physics. It is designed to help research in robotic manipulation of deformable objects.

tools.name: SeismicWaves.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Acoustic and elastic seismic wave propagation solver with adjoint-based gradients
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for simulating acoustic and elastic seismic wave propagation and computing gradients using the adjoint method, designed for geophysical inversion tasks.

tools.name: neureka
tools.one_line_profile: Platform-independent tensor library with automatic differentiation for the JVM
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, platform-independent tensor library for the JVM (Java, Kotlin, Groovy, etc.) featuring a built-in automatic differentiation (autograd) engine for building differentiable scientific models.

tools.name: NeuraLogic
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable logic programming framework for relational learning
tools.detailed_description: A framework for deep relational learning that combines neural networks with logic programming through a differentiable logic approach, enabling learning from structured data.

tools.name: storchastic
tools.one_line_profile: Stochastic automatic differentiation library for PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A library extending PyTorch with stochastic automatic differentiation capabilities, enabling gradient estimation for stochastic computation graphs and reinforcement learning.

tools.name: Kayak
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation library for deep neural networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for automatic differentiation, specifically designed for optimizing hyperparameters and structures in deep neural networks, developed by the HIPS group.

tools.name: autograd
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation engine for NumPy code
tools.detailed_description: A foundational library that efficiently computes derivatives of NumPy code, supporting a large subset of Python features including loops, ifs, recursion, and closures.

tools.name: D.VA
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel differentiable simulation for visual-policy learning
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable simulation framework designed to accelerate visual-policy learning by enabling parallel gradient computation through the physics simulation process.

tools.name: optiland
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable optical design and ray tracing library
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python framework for optical design, optimization, and analysis, featuring GPU-accelerated and differentiable ray tracing capabilities via PyTorch.

tools.name: DiffPhysDrone
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics training framework for quadrotors
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics-based training framework for real-world quadrotor control, enabling end-to-end optimization of control policies through physical simulation.

tools.name: DiffIPC
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable solver for time-dependent deformation with contact
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable solver implementing the Incremental Potential Contact (IPC) method for simulating and optimizing time-dependent deformation problems involving contact.

tools.name: simulai
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for physics-informed machine learning pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed for building data-driven pipelines in physics-informed machine learning, supporting the integration of physical laws into neural network models.

tools.name: JANC
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable compressible reacting flow solver
tools.detailed_description: A fully-differentiable solver for compressible reacting flows, built on JAX-AMR, enabling gradient-based optimization for fluid dynamics and combustion problems.

tools.name: JAX-DIPS
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable interfacial PDE solver using JAX
tools.detailed_description: A JAX-based differentiable solver for partial differential equations involving interfaces, suitable for multiphase flow and interfacial dynamics problems.

tools.name: Twin4Build
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable building simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework for dynamic simulation of buildings using differentiable data-driven models, designed for digital twin applications and energy optimization.

tools.name: PhysTwin
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-informed reconstruction and simulation of deformable objects
tools.detailed_description: A tool for reconstructing and simulating deformable objects from videos using physics-informed methods, enabling differentiable simulation for digital twins.

tools.name: PINNs-based-MPC
tools.one_line_profile: PINN-based Model Predictive Control framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework implementing nonlinear model predictive control (NMPC) using Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) to approximate system dynamics and compute sensitivities via automatic differentiation.

tools.name: ArrayInterface.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Base array interface primitives for scientific machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A foundational library providing array interface primitives and traits used extensively throughout the Julia Scientific Machine Learning (SciML) ecosystem to support differentiability and hardware acceleration.

tools.name: AstroNbodySim.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable gravitational N-body simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for performing unitful and differentiable gravitational N-body simulations, suitable for astrophysical dynamics and optimization.

tools.name: ImplicitDifferentiation.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation for implicit functions in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package that provides automatic differentiation capabilities for functions defined implicitly (e.g., solutions to equations or optimization problems), enabling their use in differentiable programming pipelines.

tools.name: AbstractDifferentiation.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Abstract interface for automatic differentiation backends
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package defining a common abstract interface for various automatic differentiation backends, facilitating interoperability and backend switching in scientific codes.

tools.name: ChainRules.jl
tools.one_line_profile: AD primitives for Julia Base and standard libraries
tools.detailed_description: A library providing a collection of forward and reverse mode automatic differentiation rules (primitives) for Julia's Base and Standard Libraries, serving as a foundation for the Julia AD ecosystem.

tools.name: DifferentiationInterface.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Unified interface for AD backends in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight interface package that unifies access to multiple automatic differentiation backends in Julia, simplifying the integration of AD into scientific software.

tools.name: ForwardDiff.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Forward mode automatic differentiation for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A robust library for forward mode automatic differentiation in Julia, optimized for computing directional derivatives, gradients, and Jacobians of native Julia code.

tools.name: ReverseDiff.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Reverse mode automatic differentiation for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A library for reverse mode automatic differentiation in Julia, suitable for computing gradients of scalar-valued functions with large input spaces.

tools.name: TopOpt.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Topology optimization using automatic differentiation
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for performing 2D and 3D topology optimization on unstructured meshes, leveraging automatic differentiation for sensitivity analysis.

tools.name: Brancher
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable probabilistic programming and variational inference library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for defining differentiable probabilistic models and performing stochastic variational inference, designed for flexibility in probabilistic programming.

tools.name: PyNeuraLogic
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for differentiable logic programming
tools.detailed_description: A Python library enabling the creation of differentiable logic programs, allowing for the integration of symbolic reasoning with deep learning optimization.

tools.name: NeuralSolver
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable solver search framework for diffusion sampling
tools.detailed_description: A framework for searching and optimizing differentiable solvers to accelerate diffusion model sampling, as presented at ICML 2025.

tools.name: zigrad
tools.one_line_profile: Autograd engine and deep learning framework in Zig
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework and automatic differentiation engine implemented in the Zig programming language, offering high-level abstractions with low-level control.

tools.name: torchoptics
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable wave optics simulation library
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library for differentiable wave optics simulation, enabling gradient-based optimization of optical systems and components.

tools.name: diff-SAT
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable SAT solver for probabilistic programming
tools.detailed_description: A solver for probabilistic Answer Set Programming and SAT solving that utilizes differentiable satisfiability techniques to integrate logical constraints with probabilistic inference.

tools.name: lqrax
tools.one_line_profile: Auto-differentiable LQR solver with JAX
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-friendly, auto-differentiable Linear-Quadratic Regulator (LQR) solver implemented in JAX, designed for optimal control problems requiring gradient-based optimization.

tools.name: WarpDiffRobot
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable robot-object interaction simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework for calibrating object properties and simulating robot-object interactions using differentiable physics, facilitating sim-to-real transfer and parameter estimation.

tools.name: MegEngine
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework with built-in automatic differentiation
tools.detailed_description: A fast, scalable, and easy-to-use deep learning framework that provides a comprehensive automatic differentiation engine, supporting dynamic graph construction and training.

tools.name: DiffRL
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable simulation for reinforcement learning
tools.detailed_description: A library for accelerated policy learning that leverages parallel differentiable simulation to compute gradients for reinforcement learning tasks efficiently.

tools.name: neurodiffeq
tools.one_line_profile: Library for solving differential equations with neural networks
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library for solving ordinary and partial differential equations (ODEs/PDEs) using neural networks, implementing various physics-informed learning strategies.

tools.name: NonlinearEquations.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation for sparse nonlinear equations
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package from LANL for automatically differentiating sparse systems of nonlinear equations, facilitating the solution of complex physical models.

tools.name: julia2pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: Bridge for differentiating Julia functions in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A tool enabling functions differentiable with Zygote.jl in Julia to be integrated into PyTorch computation graphs and differentiated, bridging the two ecosystems.

tools.name: PML-UCF/pinn
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-informed neural networks (PINN) package for solving PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) for solving partial differential equations and identifying parameters in physical systems.

tools.name: AutoDiff
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation library for Python and NumPy
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight automatic differentiation library implemented in Python, supporting forward and reverse modes for computing derivatives of NumPy functions.

tools.name: PennyLane
tools.one_line_profile: Library for quantum machine learning and differentiable quantum computing
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform Python library for differentiable programming of quantum computers. It integrates quantum simulators and hardware with machine learning libraries like PyTorch and TensorFlow.

tools.name: NeuralSolvers
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network based solvers for PDEs and inverse problems
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of physics-informed neural networks and other neural solvers for partial differential equations and inverse problems.

tools.name: torch-diffsim
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics simulator in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A minimal, parallelizable physics simulator supporting differentiation entirely within PyTorch, enabling gradient-based optimization of physical parameters.

tools.name: Aquarium.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable fluid-structure interaction solver
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable fluid-structure interaction (FSI) solver written in Julia, designed for robotics applications and control optimization.

tools.name: Jittor-NODE
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable ODE solvers using Jittor
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (Neural ODEs) and differentiable ODE solvers using the Jittor deep learning framework.

tools.name: AutoOptimize.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic optimization and parallelization for SciML
tools.detailed_description: A tool for automatically optimizing and parallelizing scientific machine learning code in Julia, leveraging symbolic analysis.

tools.name: Catalyst.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Chemical reaction network modeling interface
tools.detailed_description: A domain-specific language and library for modeling chemical reaction networks and systems biology, integrating with the SciML ecosystem for simulation and analysis.

tools.name: DataDrivenDiffEq.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Data-driven modeling and dynamical system discovery
tools.detailed_description: A library for automated discovery of dynamical systems and physics equations from data using techniques like SINDy and DMD.

tools.name: DiffEqBase.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Base library for differential equation definitions
tools.detailed_description: The core library defining the common interface, types, and traits for differential equations and scientific machine learning problems in the SciML ecosystem.

tools.name: DiffEqBayes.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian parameter estimation for differential equations
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing Bayesian inference and parameter estimation on differential equation models using MCMC and other probabilistic methods.

tools.name: DiffEqCallbacks.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Event handling callbacks for differential equation solvers
tools.detailed_description: A library providing various callbacks (events) for differential equation solvers, enabling complex simulation logic like discontinuities and state modifications.

tools.name: DiffEqFlux.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Neural differential equations and scientific machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A library for integrating differential equations with neural networks (Neural ODEs, SDEs, etc.) and performing physics-informed machine learning.

tools.name: DiffEqGPU.jl
tools.one_line_profile: GPU acceleration for differential equation solvers
tools.detailed_description: A library enabling GPU acceleration for ensemble simulations and solvers within the DifferentialEquations.jl ecosystem.

tools.name: DiffEqOperators.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Finite difference operators for differential equations
tools.detailed_description: A library providing linear operators for discretizing differential equations, particularly for finite difference methods.

tools.name: DiffEqProblemLibrary.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Library of standard differential equation problems
tools.detailed_description: A collection of pre-defined differential equation problems (ODEs, SDEs, DAEs) used for testing, benchmarking, and examples.

tools.name: DifferentialEquations.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive differential equation solver suite
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance suite for solving ordinary, stochastic, delay, and differential-algebraic equations, serving as the core solver ecosystem for SciML.

tools.name: FEniCS.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia wrapper for the FEniCS finite element library
tools.detailed_description: A wrapper allowing the use of the FEniCS Finite Element library within Julia, enabling PDE solving and integration with SciML tools.

tools.name: FluxNeuralOperators.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Neural operators (DeepONet, FNO) library
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing neural operators such as DeepONets and Fourier Neural Operators (FNO) for learning operators mapping between function spaces.

tools.name: Integrals.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Numerical integration and quadrature interface
tools.detailed_description: A common interface for numerical integration (quadrature) methods, supporting various backends and high-dimensional integration.

tools.name: JumpProcesses.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of jump processes and Gillespie algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A library for simulating jump processes, including Gillespie simulations and jump diffusions, compatible with the differential equation solvers.

tools.name: LabelledArrays.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Arrays with labeled elements for scientific modeling
tools.detailed_description: A utility library providing arrays where elements can be accessed by label, simplifying the definition and handling of parameters and states in scientific models.

tools.name: ModelingToolkit.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Acausal modeling and symbolic transformation framework
tools.detailed_description: A modeling framework for high-performance symbolic-numeric computation, allowing for acausal modeling, automated model transformation, and code generation.

tools.name: MultiScaleArrays.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Data structures for multi-scale scientific simulations
tools.detailed_description: A framework for creating and handling multi-scale array structures, useful for simulations involving hierarchical or multi-scale biological/physical systems.

tools.name: NBodySimulator.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable N-body simulator
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable simulator for N-body problems, suitable for astrophysical and molecular dynamics simulations within the SciML ecosystem.

tools.name: NeuralPDE.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINN) solver library
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for solving partial differential equations using Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) and other neural PDE solvers.

tools.name: NonlinearSolve.jl
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance nonlinear equation solvers
tools.detailed_description: A library of solvers for systems of nonlinear equations, featuring Newton methods, bracketed rootfinding, and support for automatic differentiation.

tools.name: ODE.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Basic Ordinary Differential Equation solvers (Legacy)
tools.detailed_description: A collection of basic ODE solvers. While largely deprecated in favor of DifferentialEquations.jl, it remains a functional solver library.

tools.name: OrdinaryDiffEq.jl
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance ODE and DAE solvers
tools.detailed_description: The primary component of DifferentialEquations.jl containing high-performance solvers for ordinary differential equations and differential-algebraic equations.

tools.name: ParameterizedFunctions.jl
tools.one_line_profile: DSL for defining parameterized differential equations
tools.detailed_description: A domain-specific language (DSL) macro for easily defining differential equations with parameters, facilitating model definition in SciML.

tools.name: PreallocationTools.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for non-allocating pre-cached functions
tools.detailed_description: Utilities to create non-allocating functions that are compatible with automatic differentiation (Dual numbers), essential for high-performance scientific code.

tools.name: QuasiMonteCarlo.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Quasi-Monte Carlo sequence generation
tools.detailed_description: A library for generating quasi-Monte Carlo sequences (e.g., Sobol, Halton) for numerical integration and parameter space exploration.

tools.name: RecursiveArrayTools.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for handling recursive array structures
tools.detailed_description: Utilities for handling complex nested array structures (like arrays of arrays) commonly found in differential equation states and scientific computing.

tools.name: ReservoirComputing.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Reservoir computing and echo state networks library
tools.detailed_description: A library for implementing reservoir computing models, such as Echo State Networks (ESN), for time series prediction and scientific machine learning.

tools.name: SciMLExpectations.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Uncertainty quantification for differential equations
tools.detailed_description: A library for calculating expectations and performing uncertainty quantification on differential equation solutions.

tools.name: SciMLSensitivity.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Sensitivity analysis and adjoints for SciML
tools.detailed_description: A library providing sensitivity analysis methods (adjoints) for differential equations, enabling gradient-based optimization and training of Neural ODEs.

tools.name: StochasticDiffEq.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Solvers for stochastic differential equations in Julia
tools.detailed_description: Solvers for stochastic differential equations which connect with the scientific machine learning (SciML) ecosystem.

tools.name: Surrogates.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Surrogate modeling and optimization library
tools.detailed_description: Surrogate modeling and optimization for scientific machine learning (SciML).

tools.name: diffeqpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for DifferentialEquations.jl
tools.detailed_description: Solving differential equations in Python using DifferentialEquations.jl and the SciML Scientific Machine Learning organization.

tools.name: diffeqr
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for DifferentialEquations.jl
tools.detailed_description: Solving differential equations in R using DifferentialEquations.jl and the SciML Scientific Machine Learning ecosystem.

tools.name: Numpy.NET
tools.one_line_profile: C#/F# bindings for NumPy scientific computing library
tools.detailed_description: C#/F# bindings for NumPy - a fundamental library for scientific computing, machine learning and AI.

tools.name: XFEM_Fracture2D
tools.one_line_profile: Matlab program for 2D fracture mechanics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A Matlab program to solve fracture problems involving arbitrary multiple crack propagations in a 2D linear-elastic solid based on the principle of minimum potential energy using Extended Finite Element Method (XFEM).

tools.name: diff-hybrid-traffic-sim
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable hybrid traffic simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: Differentiable hybrid traffic simulation (SIGGRAPH ASIA 2022). A traffic simulator supporting differentiation for optimization and learning.

tools.name: JAX-CPFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable crystal plasticity finite element method on GPU
tools.detailed_description: Efficient GPU-computing simulation for differentiable crystal plasticity finite element method (CPFEM) implemented in JAX.

tools.name: FMI.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for Functional Mock-up Interface (FMI) integration
tools.detailed_description: FMI.jl integrates FMI (fmi-standard.org): load or create, parameterize, differentiate and simulate FMUs seamlessly inside the Julia programming language.

tools.name: ADEKF
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Differentiated Extended Kalman Filter
tools.detailed_description: A generic EKF Implementation that uses automatic differentiation to get rid of the need to define Jacobians manually.

tools.name: DistributionsAD.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation for probability distributions in Julia
tools.detailed_description: Automatic differentiation of Distributions using Tracker, Zygote, ForwardDiff and ReverseDiff, enabling differentiable probabilistic programming.

tools.name: PyPOTS
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolkit for partially-observed time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit/library for data mining on partially-observed time series, including imputation, classification, clustering, forecasting, and anomaly detection.

tools.name: DIFFICE_jax
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable solver for ice shelf data assimilation
tools.detailed_description: Differentiable neural-network solver for data assimilation of ice shelves written in JAX.

tools.name: diff_fem
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable simulation of soft multi-body systems
tools.detailed_description: Differentiable Simulation of Soft Multi-body Systems using FEM, enabling gradient-based optimization for physical systems.

tools.name: diffarticulated

tools.name: Dr.Jit Core

tools.detailed_description: The core infrastructure library for Dr.Jit, providing the fundamental data structures and JIT compilation mechanisms for differentiable computing.

tools.name: ReverseDiffSparse.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Reverse-mode automatic differentiation for sparse Hessians in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library implementing reverse-mode automatic differentiation specifically optimized for computing sparse Hessians, useful in large-scale scientific optimization problems.

tools.name: torch (R)
tools.one_line_profile: R interface to PyTorch for scientific computing
tools.detailed_description: The R interface to the Torch library, enabling scientific machine learning, tensor computations, and automatic differentiation directly within the R environment.

tools.name: Arraymancer
tools.one_line_profile: Tensor library for scientific computing in Nim
tools.detailed_description: A fast and ergonomic tensor library for the Nim programming language, providing N-dimensional arrays, automatic differentiation, and deep learning support for scientific computing on CPU and GPU.

tools.name: backprop
tools.one_line_profile: Heterogeneous automatic differentiation in Haskell
tools.detailed_description: A Haskell library for automatic differentiation (backpropagation) that supports heterogeneous types, enabling differentiable programming and gradient-based optimization in functional programming contexts.

tools.name: hamilton
tools.one_line_profile: Hamiltonian mechanics simulation with automatic differentiation
tools.detailed_description: A Haskell library for simulating physics using Hamiltonian mechanics on generalized coordinate systems, leveraging automatic differentiation to derive equations of motion automatically.

tools.name: DIMOS
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Molecular Simulator framework
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based framework for differentiable molecular simulations, enabling machine-learning enhanced force fields and optimization of molecular properties through automatic differentiation.

tools.name: Norse
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning with spiking neural networks in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A library for deep learning with Spiking Neural Networks (SNNs) built on PyTorch, providing differentiable neuron models for bio-inspired computing and scientific simulation.

tools.name: DiffCloth
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable cloth simulation solver
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics solver specifically for cloth simulation with frictional contact, enabling gradient-based optimization for material parameter estimation and control tasks.

tools.name: osqpth
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable OSQP solver layer for PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch wrapper for the OSQP (Operator Splitting Quadratic Program) solver, allowing quadratic programming optimization problems to be embedded as differentiable layers in neural networks.

tools.name: Owl
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific computing library for OCaml
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive scientific computing library for OCaml, providing N-dimensional arrays, linear algebra, automatic differentiation, and optimization algorithms, similar to NumPy/SciPy.

tools.name: DL4S
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated tensor operations and AD for Swift
tools.detailed_description: A library for accelerated tensor operations and reverse-mode automatic differentiation in Swift, designed to run on various devices from watchOS to Linux.

tools.name: tesseract-jax
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Tesseract structures for JAX
tools.detailed_description: A library to execute and differentiate 'Tesseract' data structures/simulations as part of JAX programs, supporting JIT compilation and gradient computation for scientific workflows.

tools.name: TinyAD
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation for geometry processing
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight C++ library for automatic differentiation specifically designed for geometry processing and optimization tasks, simplifying the implementation of derivatives in geometric algorithms.

tools.name: Diffrax
tools.one_line_profile: Numerical differential equation solvers in JAX with autodiff support
tools.detailed_description: Diffrax provides numerical solvers for ordinary, stochastic, and controlled differential equations (ODEs, SDEs, CDEs) written in JAX. It supports automatic differentiation, GPU acceleration, and integrates seamlessly with the JAX ecosystem for scientific machine learning.

tools.name: Equinox
tools.one_line_profile: Callable PyTrees and neural networks for scientific computing in JAX
tools.detailed_description: Equinox brings a PyTorch-like class-based API to JAX, facilitating the construction of neural networks and scientific models. It is designed to work with JAX's functional transformations (grad, jit, vmap) while maintaining an elegant object-oriented interface.

tools.name: torchcde
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable controlled differential equation solvers for PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: torchcde provides differentiable solvers for Controlled Differential Equations (CDEs) in PyTorch, enabling the processing of irregular time series data. It features GPU support and memory-efficient adjoint backpropagation.

tools.name: autodiff (Go)
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation library for the Go programming language
tools.detailed_description: A numerical library for Go that supports automatic differentiation, implementing routines for linear algebra, numerical optimization, and statistics, enabling differentiable programming in Go applications.

tools.name: Numdifftools
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic numerical differentiation for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that solves automatic numerical differentiation problems in one or more variables. It provides tools to compute gradients, Hessians, and Jacobians using finite difference methods when analytical derivatives are unavailable.

tools.name: PDEBench
tools.one_line_profile: Extensive benchmark suite for Scientific Machine Learning
tools.detailed_description: PDEBench is a comprehensive benchmark framework for Scientific Machine Learning (SciML), providing diverse PDE datasets and evaluation metrics to test and compare different machine learning models for physics simulation.

tools.name: AeroSandbox
tools.one_line_profile: Aircraft design optimization using automatic differentiation
tools.detailed_description: AeroSandbox is a Python package for aircraft design optimization that leverages automatic differentiation for fast gradient-based optimization. It includes composable analysis tools for aerodynamics, propulsion, structures, and trajectory design.

tools.name: NeuralFoil
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-informed machine learning tool for airfoil aerodynamics
tools.detailed_description: NeuralFoil is a practical airfoil aerodynamics analysis tool that uses physics-informed machine learning to provide fast and accurate predictions, exposed to end-users via a pure Python/NumPy interface.

tools.name: Neuromancer
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable programming framework for constrained optimization and system ID
tools.detailed_description: Neuromancer is a PyTorch-based framework designed for solving parametric constrained optimization problems, physics-informed system identification, and parametric model predictive control using differentiable programming techniques.

tools.name: VMAS
tools.one_line_profile: Vectorized differentiable simulator for Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
tools.detailed_description: VectorizedMultiAgentSimulator (VMAS) is a differentiable physics engine written in PyTorch, designed for efficient benchmarking of Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning (MARL) in 2D physics-based scenarios.

tools.name: CGDMS
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable molecular simulation of proteins
tools.detailed_description: CGDMS enables differentiable molecular simulation of proteins using a coarse-grained potential. It allows for the optimization of force field parameters or molecular structures by backpropagating through the simulation trajectory.

tools.name: Pymanopt
tools.one_line_profile: Optimization on Riemannian manifolds with automatic differentiation
tools.detailed_description: Pymanopt is a Python toolbox for optimization on Riemannian manifolds. It simplifies the calculation of derivatives and gradients on manifolds by supporting automatic differentiation backends like Autograd, JAX, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.

tools.name: PyPose
tools.one_line_profile: Library for differentiable robotics on manifolds
tools.detailed_description: PyPose is a PyTorch-based library for differentiable robotics. It provides a set of tools for handling Lie groups, rigid body dynamics, and other manifold operations, enabling end-to-end learning in robotics applications.

tools.name: NumPyro
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic programming with NumPy powered by JAX
tools.detailed_description: NumPyro is a lightweight probabilistic programming library that provides a NumPy backend for Pyro. It leverages JAX for automatic differentiation and JIT compilation, enabling fast inference and MCMC sampling on GPUs and TPUs.

tools.name: functorch
tools.one_line_profile: Composable function transforms for PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: functorch provides JAX-like composable function transforms (such as vmap, grad, and vjp) for PyTorch. It enables efficient parallelization and differentiation of PyTorch models and is now integrated into the core PyTorch library.

tools.name: PyTorch
tools.one_line_profile: Tensors and dynamic neural networks with GPU acceleration
tools.detailed_description: PyTorch is a leading open-source machine learning framework that provides a flexible and efficient platform for deep learning and differentiable programming. It features dynamic computational graphs and extensive support for scientific computing tasks.

tools.name: R6RS-AD
tools.one_line_profile: Forward and Reverse Mode Automatic Differentiation in Scheme
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing forward and reverse mode Automatic Differentiation (AD) for R6RS Scheme. It also includes extensions to support nondeterministic and stochastic programming.

tools.name: rust-autograd
tools.one_line_profile: Tensors and differentiable operations in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library providing tensor operations and automatic differentiation capabilities, similar to TensorFlow or PyTorch, enabling differentiable programming in the Rust ecosystem.

tools.name: tensorflow-forward-ad
tools.one_line_profile: Forward-mode Automatic Differentiation for TensorFlow
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of forward-mode automatic differentiation for TensorFlow, allowing for the computation of Jacobian-vector products and other derivatives not natively optimized in standard reverse-mode TF.

tools.name: rewarped
tools.one_line_profile: Reinforcement learning in differentiable multiphysics simulation with NVIDIA Warp
tools.detailed_description: Rewarped integrates reinforcement learning with differentiable multiphysics simulations using NVIDIA Warp. It enables the training of agents in complex physical environments where gradients can be propagated through the physics engine.

tools.name: Adept-2
tools.one_line_profile: Combined array and automatic differentiation library in C++
tools.detailed_description: Adept-2 is a fast C++ library for automatic differentiation that combines array operations with differentiation capabilities. It is designed for performance and ease of use in C++ scientific applications.

tools.name: MyGrad
tools.one_line_profile: Drop-in autodiff library for NumPy
tools.detailed_description: MyGrad is a lightweight, pure-Python automatic differentiation library designed to be a drop-in replacement for NumPy. It allows users to perform autograd on NumPy-like arrays with a syntax very similar to PyTorch.

tools.name: torchdiffeq
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable ODE solvers with GPU support for PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: torchdiffeq provides differentiable Ordinary Differential Equation (ODE) solvers for PyTorch. It implements the adjoint sensitivity method for O(1) memory backpropagation, making it suitable for Neural ODEs and other continuous-depth models.

tools.name: pytorch_sparse
tools.one_line_profile: Optimized Autograd Sparse Matrix Operations for PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch extension library that provides optimized sparse matrix operations with autograd support. It is essential for Graph Neural Networks and other applications involving sparse data in differentiable programming.

tools.name: FWISIMAT
tools.one_line_profile: Full-waveform inversion in acoustic isotropic media
tools.detailed_description: FWISIMAT is a MATLAB-based tool for full-waveform inversion (FWI) in acoustic isotropic media using the adjoint state method. It facilitates the reconstruction of subsurface velocity models from seismic data.

tools.name: NeuralLaplace
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Laplace reconstructions for modeling time-series dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing Neural Laplace, a differentiable method for modeling temporal dynamics using Laplace transforms, offering O(1) complexity for time observation modeling.

tools.name: PyApprox
tools.one_line_profile: High-dimensional approximation and uncertainty quantification tools
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for high-dimensional function approximation, scientific machine learning, and uncertainty quantification (UQ), developed by Sandia National Laboratories.

tools.name: PADO
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch-based differentiable optics simulation library
tools.detailed_description: Pytorch Automatic Differentiable Optics (PADO) is a library for simulating and optimizing optical systems using differentiable programming techniques.

tools.name: Jutul.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Fully-differentiable multi-physics finite-volume simulator
tools.detailed_description: A highly performant and differentiable simulator for multi-physics problems using finite-volume methods, suitable for reservoir simulation and other porous media flows.

tools.name: DualNumbers
tools.one_line_profile: Dual numbers implementation for automatic differentiation
tools.detailed_description: A Mathematica implementation of dual numbers, enabling forward-mode automatic differentiation for mathematical programs.

tools.name: Stan Math Library
tools.one_line_profile: C++ template library for automatic differentiation
tools.detailed_description: The core math library for the Stan probabilistic programming language, providing robust forward, reverse, and mixed-mode automatic differentiation and probability functions.

tools.name: SocialForce
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Social Force simulation for pedestrian dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable implementation of the Social Force model for simulating pedestrian dynamics and crowd interactions, enabling parameter optimization and calibration.

tools.name: MarineHydro.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable boundary element simulations for offshore structures
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for differentiable hydrodynamic analysis of offshore structures using boundary element methods, facilitating design optimization.

tools.name: TensorDiffEq
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-Informed Deep Learning framework on TensorFlow
tools.detailed_description: A scalable framework for Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) and scientific machine learning built on TensorFlow, supporting distributed computing.

tools.name: Tensorlang
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable programming language based on TensorFlow
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable programming language designed to compile to TensorFlow graphs, facilitating the development of differentiable algorithms and models.

tools.name: TensorLy
tools.one_line_profile: Tensor learning and algebra library for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for tensor learning and algebra, providing high-level APIs for tensor decomposition and operations, compatible with multiple backends (NumPy, PyTorch, JAX, etc.).

tools.name: TensorGrad
tools.one_line_profile: Symbolic tensor library for machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A library for machine learning with symbolic tensors, enabling symbolic differentiation and manipulation of tensor expressions.

tools.name: RoboDojo.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable simulator for robotic systems
tools.detailed_description: A fast and differentiable physics simulator for robotic systems in Julia, designed for control and reinforcement learning research.

tools.name: PhiFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable PDE solving framework for machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable PDE solving framework built for machine learning applications, supporting fluid dynamics and other physical simulations with PyTorch/TensorFlow/JAX integration.

tools.name: ApeBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for autoregressive neural emulation of PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark suite for evaluating autoregressive neural network models in emulating partial differential equations (PDEs), covering 1D, 2D, and 3D physics problems.

tools.name: Torch Autograd
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation for Lua Torch
tools.detailed_description: An automatic differentiation library for the legacy Lua Torch framework, enabling gradient-based optimization for native Torch code.

tools.name: JWave
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based differentiable acoustic simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: A research framework for differentiable and parallelizable acoustic simulations using JAX, supporting execution on CPU, GPU, and TPU.

tools.name: Mystic
tools.one_line_profile: Constrained nonlinear optimization framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework for constrained nonlinear optimization, designed for scientific machine learning and uncertainty quantification, capable of handling complex constraints.

tools.name: PyTorchGeoNodes
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable shape programs from Blender to PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A tool that translates Blender geometry node models into PyTorch code, enabling differentiable procedural modeling and shape programs for 3D scientific and vision tasks.

tools.name: Clad
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation for C/C++
tools.detailed_description: A Clang plugin and library for automatic differentiation of C/C++ code, enabling gradient computation for existing C++ scientific codebases.

tools.name: VTL
tools.one_line_profile: Tensor library for the V language
tools.detailed_description: A numerical computing library for the V programming language, providing N-dimensional tensors and linear algebra operations similar to NumPy.

tools.name: tensorgrad
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable programming library for tensor networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing differentiable programming for tensor networks, enabling gradient-based optimization of tensor network states and operators, useful in quantum physics and machine learning.

tools.name: Pontryagin-Differentiable-Programming
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end learning and control framework using Pontryagin's Maximum Principle
tools.detailed_description: A unified framework for solving control tasks by integrating Pontryagin's Maximum Principle with differentiable programming, allowing for the learning of objective functions, dynamics, and policies in control systems.

tools.name: Safe-PDP
tools.one_line_profile: Safe differentiable framework for safety-critical learning and control
tools.detailed_description: A theoretical and algorithmic framework extending Pontryagin Differentiable Programming to handle safety constraints in learning and control tasks, ensuring safe optimal trajectories.

tools.name: Waymax
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based differentiable simulator for autonomous driving research
tools.detailed_description: A hardware-accelerated, differentiable simulator built on JAX for autonomous driving research, supporting multi-agent environments and efficient training of planning policies.

tools.name: Keras_ODENet
tools.one_line_profile: Keras implementation of Neural Ordinary Differential Equations
tools.detailed_description: A library extension providing Keras layers and models for Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (Neural ODEs), facilitating the integration of continuous-depth models into standard deep learning workflows.

tools.name: grcwa
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Rigorous Coupled Wave Analysis (RCWA) implementation
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Rigorous Coupled Wave Analysis (RCWA) method for electromagnetic simulation, supporting automatic differentiation (Autograd) for inverse design and optimization in photonics.

tools.name: diff-surfel-tracing
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable 2D Gaussian ray tracer for light transport simulation
tools.detailed_description: A fully differentiable 2D Gaussian ray tracer built on OptiX, supporting multiple-bounce path tracing and integration into optimization loops for inverse rendering and light transport simulation.

tools.name: Py_PSNODE
tools.one_line_profile: Neural ODE and DAE modules for power system dynamic modeling
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing general Neural ODE and Differential Algebraic Equation (DAE) modules specifically designed for modeling the dynamics of power systems.

tools.name: score_sde
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for score-based generative modeling via Stochastic Differential Equations
tools.detailed_description: The reference implementation and framework for score-based generative modeling using Stochastic Differential Equations (SDEs), providing solvers and training routines for continuous-time generative models.

tools.name: APDTFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Time series forecasting framework using Neural ODEs
tools.detailed_description: An extensible forecasting framework for time series data that integrates Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (Neural ODEs), transformer components, and probabilistic modeling.

tools.name: Seq2SeqSharp
tools.one_line_profile: Tensor-based deep neural network framework with automatic differentiation in .NET
tools.detailed_description: A fast and flexible deep neural network framework written in C# (.NET) featuring automatic differentiation, tensor operations, and support for various network architectures like Transformers and LSTMs.

tools.name: PhyLSTM
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-informed LSTM framework for structural system metamodeling
tools.detailed_description: A physics-informed LSTM framework designed for metamodeling nonlinear structural systems, particularly useful when data is scarce by incorporating physical laws into the learning process.

tools.name: TextGrad
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation via Large Language Models
tools.detailed_description: A framework that implements automatic differentiation using large language models to backpropagate textual gradients, enabling the optimization of complex, text-based systems and workflows.
